Package org.javautil.document.style

A generic framework for rendering styles in documents.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Borders  
FontAttributes Interface describing additional feature settings that can be applied to font rendering in order to utilize document or format specific features.
Style An abstraction of a cell style.
StyleParser Parses a StyleDefinition into a Style.
 

Class Summary
ColorUtil Provides methods for manipulating java.awt.Color objects from string and numeric representations.
DefaultStyleParser A default implementation of StyleParser that creates styles evaluating style definition values against enumerations and booleans.
DocumentStyles Contains a named map of Style objects that can be generated from various configuration files.
FontAttributesImpl Basic implementation of FontAttributes taking most of its functionality from java.util.TreeMap.
LineSettings  
SimpleBorder  
StyleDefinition A style represented in pure string format; more human readable.
StyleFactory  
StyleImpl A simple implementation of Style that provides bean methods for manipulating properties as described in the interface.
StyleUtil Useful static helper methods for working with Style and StyleDefinition objects.
 

Enum Summary
BoldWeight  
FontUnderlineStyle Possible values for an underline style; not all values are necessarily possible by the underlying document style.
HorizontalAlignment Possible values for horizontal alignment; not all values are necessarily possible by the underlying document style.
VerticalAlignment Possible values for vertical alignment; not all values are necessarily possible by the underlying document style.
 

Package org.javautil.document.style Description

A generic framework for rendering styles in documents. This includes classes for constructing definitions from a spring context and eventually writing styles into writable document specific java objects.

Author:
bcm
